raw_text:
```json { "price_recommendation": 30, "description_html": "

This edition of "The Two Gentlemen of Verona" is part of the renowned Arden Shakespeare series, noted for its comprehensive and scholarly approach to Shakespeare's works. This edition, first published in 1969, provides modern readers with editorial insights by Clifford Leech, who is known for his expertise in early modern drama. The Arden Shakespeare editions are favored by academics, making them a staple for serious students of Shakespeare.

Bibliographic Details

  • Author: William Shakespeare
  • Title: The Two Gentlemen of Verona
  • Publication: 1969, Methuen & Co Ltd, London, UK
  • Edition: First Edition in this 'completely revised and reset' form
  • Binding: Hardcover in publisher's turquoise cloth
  • Dust Jacket: Present with some wear and minor tears
  • Notable Features: Part of the respected Arden Shakespeare series, edited by Clifford Leech

Condition

Conservative ABAA-style assessment

  • Boards/Spine/Hinges: Minimal wear to boards, some minor bumping to corners, spine ends slightly rubbed
  • Edges: Clean and sharp with little signs of use
  • Pages/Interior: Clean and bright, no markings, minimal toning

Overall: Very Good in Good Dust Jacket

" } ```
